notes.title: notes
notes.description: Notes associated with this record – may be multiline.

version.title: version
version.description: BeerXML version of the record.  Should always be “1” for this version of the XML standard.

uuid.title: uuid
uuid.description: Firestore generated uuid for a doc/collection.

amount_is_weight.title: The Amount_is_weight Schema
amount_is_weight.description: TRUE if the amount measurement is a weight measurement and FALSE if the amount is a volume measurement.  Default value (if not present) is assumed to be FALSE.

mashProfile.title: mashProfile
mashProfile.description: A collection of mashSteps that describe the MASH stage of brewing.

sparge_temp.title: sparge_temp
sparge_temp.description: Temperature of the sparge water used in degrees Celcius.

equip_adjust.title: equip_adjust
equip_adjust.description: If TRUE mash infusion and decoction calculations should take into account the temperature effects of the equipment (tun specific heat and tun weight).  If FALSE the tun is assumed to be pre-heated.  Default is FALSE.

tun_weight.title: tun_weight
tun_weight.description: Weight of the mash tun in kilograms

grain_temp.title: grain_temp
grain_temp.description: The temperature of the grain before adding it to the mash in degrees Celsius.

tun_specific_heat.title: tun_specific_heat
tun_specific_heat.description: Specific heat of the tun material in calories per gram-degree C.

tun_temp.title: tun_temp
tun_temp.description: Grain tun temperature – may be used to adjust the infusion temperature for equipment if the program supports it.  Measured in degrees C.

mash_steps.title: mashSteps
mash_steps.description: Record set that starts the list of MASH_STEP records.

origin.title: origin
origin.description: Place of origin for the hops

time.title: time
time.description: The time as measured in minutes.  Meaning is dependent on the “USE” field.  For “Boil” this is the boil time.  For “Mash” this is the mash time.  For “First Wort” this is the boil time.  For “Aroma” this is the steep time.  For “Dry Hop” this is the amount of time to dry hop.

amount.title: amount
amount.description: Weight in Kilograms of the hops used in the recipe.

beta.title: beta
beta.description: Hop beta percentage - for example '4.4' denotes 4.4 % beta

use.title: The Use Schema
use.description: May be "Boil" "Dry Hop" "Mash" "First Wort" "Aroma".  Note that "Aroma" and "Dry Hop" do not contribute to the bitterness of the beer while the others do.  Aroma hops are added after the boil and do not contribute substantially to beer bitterness.

substitutes.title: The Substitutes Schema
substitutes.description: Substitutes that can be used for this hops

alpha.title: The Alpha Schema
alpha.description: Percent alpha of hops - for example "5.5" represents 5.5% alpha

hsi.title: The Hsi Schema
hsi.description: Hop Stability Index - defined as the percentage of hop alpha lost in 6 months of storage

tun_volume.title: The Tun_volume Schema
tun_volume.description: Volume of the mash tun in liters.  This parameter can be used to calculate if a particular mash and grain profile will fit in the mash tun.  It may also be used for thermal calculations in the case of a partially full mash tun.

lauter_deadspace.title: The Lauter_deadspace Schema
lauter_deadspace.description: Amount lost to the lauter tun and equipment associated with the lautering process.

calc_boil_volume.title: The Calc_boil_volume Schema
calc_boil_volume.description: Flag denoting that the program should calculate the boil size.  Flag may be TRUE or FALSE.  If TRUE then BOIL_SIZE = (BATCH_SIZE – TOP_UP_WATER – TRUB_CHILLER_LOSS) * (1+BOIL_TIME * EVAP_RATE )  If set then the boil size should match this value.

tun_weight.title: The Tun_weight Schema
tun_weight.description: Weight of the mash tun in kilograms.  Used primarily to calculate the thermal parameters of the mash tun – in conjunction with the volume and specific heat.

top_up_water.title: The Top_up_water Schema
top_up_water.description: The amount of top up water normally added just prior to starting fermentation.  Usually used for extract brewing.

hop_utilization.title: The Hop_utilization Schema
hop_utilization.description: Large batch hop utilization.  This value should be 100% for batches less than 20 gallons but may be higher (200% or more) for very large batch equipment.

boil_time.title: The Boil_time Schema
boil_time.description: The normal amount of time one boils for this equipment setup.  This can be used with the evaporation rate to calculate the evaporation loss.

batch_size.title: The Batch_size Schema
batch_size.description: The pre-boil volume used in this particular instance for this equipment setup.  Note that this may be a calculated value depending on the CALC_BOIL_VOLUME parameter.

boil_size.title: The Boil_size Schema
boil_size.description: The target volume of the batch at the start of fermentation.

tun_specific_heat.title: The Tun_specific_heat Schema
tun_specific_heat.description: The specific heat of the mash tun which is usually a function of the material it is made of.  Typical ranges are 0.1-0.25 for metal and 0.2-0.5 for plastic materials.

trub_chiller_loss.title: The Trub_chiller_loss Schema
trub_chiller_loss.description: The amount of wort normally lost during transition from the boiler to the fermentation vessel.  Includes both unusable wort due to trub and wort lost to the chiller and transfer systems.

evap_rate.title: The Evap_rate Schema
evap_rate.description: The percentage of wort lost to evaporation per hour of the boil.

top_up_kettle.title: The Top_up_kettle Schema
top_up_kettle.description: Amount normally added to the boil kettle before the boil.

diastatic_power.title: The Diastatic_power Schema
diastatic_power.description: The diastatic power of the grain as measured in "Lintner" units. Only appropriate for a "Grain" or "Adjunct" type otherwise this value is ignored.

protein.title: The Protein Schema
protein.description: The percent protein in the grain.  Only appropriate for a "Grain" or "Adjunct" type otherwise this value is ignored.

max_in_batch.title: The Max_in_batch Schema
max_in_batch.description: The recommended maximum percentage (by weight) this ingredient should represent in a batch of beer.

coarse_fine_diff.title: The Coarse_fine_diff Schema
coarse_fine_diff.description: Percent difference between the coarse grain yield and fine grain yield.  Only appropriate for a "Grain" or "Adjunct" type otherwise this value is ignored.

yield.title: The Yield Schema
yield.description: Percent dry yield (fine grain) for the grain or the raw yield by weight if this is an extract adjunct or sugar.

amount.title: The Amount Schema
amount.description: Weight of the fermentable extract or sugar in Kilograms.

type.title: The Type Schema
type.description: May be "Grain", "Sugar", "Extract", "Dry Extract", or "Adjunct".  Extract refers to liquid extract.

ibu_gal_per_lb.title: The Ibu_gal_per_lb Schema
ibu_gal_per_lb.description: For hopped extracts only - an estimate of the number of IBUs per pound of extract in a gallon of water.  To convert to IBUs we multiply this number by the "AMOUNT" field (in pounds) and divide by the number of gallons in the batch.  Based on a sixty minute boil.  Only suitable for use with an "Extract" type otherwise this value is ignored.

color.title: The Color Schema
color.description: The color of the item in Lovibond Units (SRM for liquid extracts).

recommend_mash.title: The Recommend_mash Schema
recommend_mash.description: TRUE if it is recommended the grain be mashed FALSE if it can be steeped.  A value of TRUE is only appropriate for a "Grain" or "Adjunct" types.  The default value is FALSE.  Note that this does NOT indicate whether the grain is mashed or not – it is only a recommendation used in recipe formulation.

moisture.title: The Moisture Schema
moisture.description: Percent moisture in the grain.  Only appropriate for a "Grain" or "Adjunct" type otherwise this value is ignored.

add_after_boil.title: The Add_after_boil Schema
add_after_boil.description: May be TRUE if this item is normally added after the boil.  The default value is FALSE since most grains are added during the mash or boil.

ramp_time.title: The Ramp_time Schema
ramp_time.description: Time in minutes to achieve the desired step temperature – useful particularly for temperature mashes where it may take some time to achieve the step temperature.

type.title: The Type Schema
type.description: May be (“Infusion” “Temperature” “Decoction”) depending on the type of step.  Infusion denotes adding hot water Temperature denotes heating with an outside heat source and decoction denotes drawing off some mash for boiling.

end_temp.title: The End_temp Schema
end_temp.description: The temperature you can expect the mash to fall to after a long mash step.  Measured in degrees Celsius.

step_temp.title: The Step_temp Schema
step_temp.description: The target temperature for this step in degrees Celsius.

step_time.title: The Step_time Schema
step_time.description: The number of minutes to spend at this step – i.e. the amount of time we are to hold this particular step temperature.

infuse_amount.title: The Infuse_amount Schema
infuse_amount.description: The volume of water in liters to infuse in this step.  Required only for infusion steps though one may also add water for temperature mash steps.  One should not have an infusion amount for decoction steps.

use_for.title: The Use_for Schema
use_for.description: Short description of what the ingredient is used for in text.

time.title: The Time Schema
time.description: Amount of time the misc was boiled steeped mashed etc in minutes.

amount.title: The Amount Schema
amount.description: Amount of item used.  The default measurements are by weight but this may be the measurement in volume units if AMOUNT_IS_WEIGHT is set to TRUE for this record.  If a liquid it is in liters if a solid the weight is measured in kilograms.

carbonation.title: The Carbonation Schema
carbonation.description: Floating point value corresponding to the target volumes of CO2 used to carbonate this beer.

carbonation_temp.title: The Carbonation_temp Schema
carbonation_temp.description: The temperature for either bottling or forced carbonation.

primary_age.title: The Primary_age Schema
primary_age.description: Time spent in the primary in days

asst_brewer.description: Optional name of the assistant brewer.

secondary_age.title: The Secondary_age Schema
secondary_age.description: Time spent in the secondary in days.

mash.title: The Mash Schema
mash.description: A MASH profile record containing one or more MASH_STEPs.  NOTE: No Mash record is needed for “Extract” type brews.

age_temp.title: The Age_temp Schema
age_temp.description: Temperature for aging the beer after bottling.

equipment.title: The Equipment Schema
equipment.description: An equipment record is optional.  If included the BATCH_SIZE and BOIL_SIZE in the equipment record must match the values in this recipe record.

tertiary_age.title: The Tertiary_age Schema
tertiary_age.description: Time spent in the third fermenter in days.

type.title: The Type Schema
type.description: May be one of (“Extract” “Partial Mash” “All Grain”)

boil_time.title: The Boil_time Schema
boil_time.description: The total time to boil the wort in minutes.

primary_temp.title: The Primary_temp Schema
primary_temp.description: Temperature in degrees Celsius for the primary fermentation.

taste_notes.description: Notes for the tasting of the beer.

boil_size.title: The Boil_size Schema
boil_size.description: Starting size for the main boil of the wort in liters.

efficiency.title: The Efficiency Schema
efficiency.description: The percent brewhouse efficiency to be used for estimating the starting gravity of the beer.   Not required for “Extract” recipes but is required for “Partial Mash” and “All Grain” recipes.

fg.title: The Fg Schema
fg.description: The measured final gravity of the finished beer.

keg_priming_factor.title: The Keg_priming_factor Schema
keg_priming_factor.description: Used to factor in the smaller amount of sugar needed for large containers.  For example this might be 0.5 for a typical 5 gallon keg since naturally priming a keg requires about 50% as much sugar as priming bottles.

priming_sugar_name.title: The Priming_sugar_name Schema
priming_sugar_name.description: Text describing the priming agent such as “Honey” or “Corn Sugar” – used only if this is not a forced carbonation

og.title: The Og Schema
og.description: The measured original (pre-fermentation) specific gravity of the beer.

hops.title: The Hops Schema
hops.description: Zero or more HOP ingredient records.

forced_carbonation.title: The Forced_carbonation Schema
forced_carbonation.description: TRUE if the batch was force carbonated using CO2 pressure FALSE if the batch was carbonated using a priming agent.  Default is FALSE

taste_rating.title: The Taste_rating Schema
taste_rating.description: Number between zero and 50.0 denoting the taste rating – corresponds to the 50 point BJCP rating system.

fermentation_stages.title: The Fermentation_stages Schema
fermentation_stages.description: The number of fermentation stages used – typically a number between one and three

age.title: The Age Schema
age.description: The time to age the beer in days after bottling.

priming_sugar_equiv.title: The Priming_sugar_equiv Schema
priming_sugar_equiv.description: Factor used to convert this priming agent to an equivalent amount of corn sugar for a bottled scenario.  For example “Dry Malt Extract” would have a value of 1.4 because it requires 1.4 times as much DME as corn sugar to carbonate.  To calculate the amount of DME needed the program can calculate the amount of corn sugar needed and then multiply by this factor.

secondary_temp.title: The Secondary_temp Schema
secondary_temp.description: Temperature in degrees Celsius for the secondary fermentation.

date.title: The Date Schema
date.description: Date brewed in a easily recognizable format such as “3 Dec 04”.

batch_size.title: The Batch_size Schema
batch_size.description: Starting size for the main boil of the wort in liters.

style.title: The Style_id Schema
style.description: The style of the beer this recipe is associated with.

style_letter.title: The Style_letter Schema
style_letter.description: The specific style number or subcategory letter associated with this particular style.  For example in the BJCP style guide an American Standard Lager would be style letter “A” under the main category.  Letters should be upper case.

abv_min.title: The Abv_min Schema
abv_min.description: The minimum recommended alcohol by volume as a percentage.

category_number.title: The Category_number Schema
category_number.description: Number or identifier associated with this style category.  For example in the BJCP style guide the “American Lager” category has a category number of “1”.

color_min.title: The Color_min Schema
color_min.description: The minimum recommended color in SRM.

ibu_max.title: The Ibu_max Schema
ibu_max.description: The recommended maximum bitterness for this style as measured in International Bitterness Units (IBUs)

type.title: The Type Schema
type.description: May be (“Lager” “Ale” “Mead” “Wheat” “Mixed” “Cider”).  Defines the type of beverage associated with this category.

color_max.title: The Color_max Schema
color_max.description: The maximum recommended color in SRM.

carb_min.title: The Carb_min Schema
carb_min.description: Minimum recommended carbonation for this style in volumes of CO2

abv_max.title: The Abv_max Schema
abv_max.description: The maximum recommended alcohol by volume as a percentage.

fg_min.title: The Fg_min Schema
fg_min.description: The minimum final gravity as measured relative to water.

examples.title: The Examples Schema
examples.description: List of example beers of this style.

carb_max.title: The Carb_max Schema
carb_max.description: The maximum recommended carbonation for this style in volumes of CO2.

ingredients.title: The Ingredients Schema
ingredients.description: Short list of suggested ingredients for this style.

ibu_min.title: The Ibu_min Schema
ibu_min.description: The recommended minimum bitterness for this style as measured in International Bitterness Units (IBUs).

og_min.title: The Og_min Schema
og_min.description: The minimum specific gravity as measured relative to water.  For example “1.040” might be a reasonable minimum for a Pale Ale.

profile.title: The Profile Schema
profile.description: Flavor and aroma profile for this style.

category.title: The Category Schema
category.description: Category that this style belongs to – usually associated with a group of styles such as “English Ales” or “Amercian Lagers”.

og_max.title: The Og_max Schema
og_max.description: The maximum specific gravity as measured relative to water.

fg_max.title: The Fg_max Schema
fg_max.description: The maximum final gravity as measured relative to water.

style_guide.title: The Style_guide Schema
style_guide.description: The name of the style guide that this particular style or category belongs to.  For example “BJCP” might denote the BJCP style guide and “AHA” would be used for the AHA style guide.

max_temperature.title: The Max_temperature Schema
max_temperature.description: The maximum recommended temperature for fermenting this yeast strain in Celsius.

product_id.title: The Product_id Schema
product_id.description: The manufacturer’s product ID label or number that identifies this particular strain of yeast.

add_to_secondary.title: The Add_to_secondary Schema
add_to_secondary.description: Flag denoting that this yeast was added for a secondary (or later) fermentation as opposed to the primary fermentation.  Useful if one uses two or more yeast strains for a single brew (eg: Lambic).  Default value is FALSE.

times_cultured.title: The Times_cultured Schema
times_cultured.description: Number of times this yeast has been reused as a harvested culture.  This number should be zero if this is a product directly from the manufacturer.

best_for.title: The Best_for Schema
best_for.description: Short list of styles or types of beer this yeast strain is best suited for.

attenuation.title: The Attenuation Schema
attenuation.description: Average attenuation for this yeast strain.

amount.title: The Amount Schema
amount.description: The amount of yeast measured in liters.  For a starter this is the size of the starter.  If the flag AMOUNT_IS_WEIGHT is set to TRUE then this measurement is in kilograms and not liters.

laboratory.title: The Laboratory Schema
laboratory.description: The name of the laboratory that produced the yeast.

min_temperature.title: The Min_temperature Schema
min_temperature.description: The minimum recommended temperature for fermenting this yeast strain in degrees Celsius.

max_reuse.title: The Max_reuse Schema
max_reuse.description: Recommended of times this yeast can be reused (recultured from a previous batch)

chloride.title: The Chloride Schema
chloride.description: The amount of Chloride (Cl) in parts per million.

amount.title: The Amount Schema
amount.description: Volume of water to use in a recipe in liters.

sodium.title: The Sodium Schema
sodium.description: The amount of Sodium (Na) in parts per million.

calcium.title: The Calcium Schema
calcium.description: The amount of calcium (Ca) in parts per million.

magnesium.title: The Magnesium Schema
magnesium.description: The amount of Magnesium (Mg) in parts per million.

sulfate.title: The Sulfate Schema
sulfate.description: The amount of Sulfate (SO4) in parts per million.

bicarbonate.title: The Bicarbonate Schema
bicarbonate.description: The amount of bicarbonate (HCO3) in parts per million.
